back.text:
Root: أ ل ف (A-L-F)
Meaning: For the accustomed security, for the unity
Pronunciation: Liʾīlāfi
Tajweed Rules: Madd Ṭabīʿī on لَا (2 counts).
Derived Words:
1. أَلِف (Alif): To be familiar/accustomed
2. تَأْلِيف (Taʾlīf): Reconciliation, bringing together
3. أُلْفَة (Ulfah): Familiarity, affection
Example Ayah: فَأَلَّفَ بَيْنَ قُلُوبِكُمْ

hint.text: A reason for the tribe's security.

back.text:
Root: ق ر ش (Q-R-Sh)
Meaning: Quraysh (the tribe)
Pronunciation: Quraysh
Tajweed Rules: Layyin on رَيْ.
Derived Words: Proper noun unique to this Surah.
Example Ayah: This is the name of the Surah.

hint.text: The tribe of the Prophet ﷺ.

back.text:
Root: ر ح ل (R-Ḥ-L)
Meaning: The journey
Pronunciation: Riḥlata
Tajweed Rules: Standard pronunciation.
Derived Words:
1. رَحَلَ (Raḥala): He journeyed
2. رَحِيل (Raḥīl): Departure
3. رَاحِلَة (Rāḥilah): A mount for a journey
Example Ayah: Rare root in Qurʾān, primarily in this Surah.

hint.text: Refers to the two trade journeys.

back.text:
Root: ش ت و (Sh-T-W)
Meaning: The winter
Pronunciation: Ash-Shitāʾ
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Shamsiyyah (lām silent); Madd Wājib Muttaṣil on شِتَاء (4–5 counts).
Derived Words: Unique to this Surah.
Example Ayah: الشِّتَاءِ وَالصَّيْفِ

hint.text: One of the two seasons of travel.

back.text:
Root: ص ي ف (Ṣ-Y-F)
Meaning: The summer
Pronunciation: Waṣ-Ṣayf
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Shamsiyyah; Istiʿlā on Ṣ; Layyin on صَيْ.
Derived Words:
1. صَافَ (Ṣāfa): To pass the summer
Example Ayah: الشِّتَاءِ وَالصَّيْفِ

Root: ع ب د (ʿ-B-D)
Meaning: So let them worship
Pronunciation: Fal-yaʿbudū
Tajweed Rules: Madd Ṭabīʿī on دُو (2 counts).
Derived Words:
1. عِبَادَة (ʿIbādah): Worship
2. عَبْد (ʿAbd): Servant
3. عَابِد (ʿĀbid): Worshipper
Example Ayah: إِيَّاكَ نَعْبُدُ وَإِيَّاكَ نَسْتَعِينُ

Root: ر ب ب (R-B-B)
Meaning: The Lord
Pronunciation: Rabba
Tajweed Rules: Shaddah on بّ.
Derived Words:
1. رَبّ (Rabb): Lord
2. تَرْبِيَة (Tarbiyah): Upbringing
3. رِبَابَة (Ribābah): Lordship
Example Ayah: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

hint.text: The one who is to be worshipped.

back.text:
Root: ب ي ت (B-Y-T)
Meaning: The House (Kaʿbah)
Pronunciation: Al-Bayt
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Qamariyyah; Layyin on بَيْ.
Derived Words:
1. بَيْت (Bayt): House
2. بُيُوت (Buyūt): Houses
Example Ayah: فِي بُيُوتٍ أَذِنَ اللَّهُ أَن تُرْفَعَ

Root: ط ع م (Ṭ-ʿ-M)
Meaning: Fed them
Pronunciation: Aṭʿamahum
Tajweed Rules: Tafkhīm on Ṭ.
Derived Words:
1. طَعَام (Ṭaʿām): Food
2. إِطْعَام (Iṭʿām): Feeding
Example Ayah: الَّذِي أَطْعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٍ

Root: ج و ع (J-W-ʿ)
Meaning: Hunger
Pronunciation: Jūʿ
Tajweed Rules: Layyin on جُو.
Derived Words:
1. جَاعَ (Jāʿa): He was hungry
2. مَجَاعَة (Majāʿah): Famine
Example Ayah: وَلَنَبْلُوَنَّكُم بِشَيْءٍ مِّنَ الْخَوْفِ وَالْجُوعِ

Root: أ م ن (A-M-N)
Meaning: And made them safe
Pronunciation: Waʾāmanahum
Tajweed Rules: Madd Ṭabīʿī on آ (2 counts).
Derived Words:
1. أَمْن (Amn): Safety
2. إِيمَان (Īmān): Faith
3. مُؤْمِن (Muʾmin): Believer
Example Ayah: وَآمَنَهُم مِّنْ خَوْفٍ

Root: خ و ف (Kh-W-F)
Meaning: Fear
Pronunciation: Khawf
Tajweed Rules: Layyin on خَوْ.
Derived Words:
1. خَافَ (Khāfa): He feared
2. مَخَافَة (Makhāfah): Fear
3. تَخْوِيف (Takhwīf): Intimidation
Example Ayah: وَلَنَبْلُوَنَّكُم بِشَيْءٍ مِّنَ الْخَوْفِ وَالْجُوعِ
